attributes.description: Overall positional accuracy of the navigation system ensuring sub-5 meter precision in diverse operating conditions.
attributes.name: positionalAccuracy

attributes.description: Data refresh rate to support dynamic flight conditions with rapid updates.
attributes.name: dataRefreshRate

attributes.description: Specified redundancy level using dual independent backup channels for sensor fusion reliability.
attributes.name: redundancyLevel

attributes.description: Communication frequency bands utilized for satellite navigation and auxiliary data links.
attributes.name: communicationBands
attributes.value: L1, L2 for GNSS; VHF/UHF for external communications

designScenario.description: Design an Advanced Navigation System for modern passenger aircraft that leverages enhanced sensor fusion, real-time data processing, and autonomous diagnostic self-checks. The system integrates multi-source inputs including GNSS, inertial sensors, and external data to compute precise flight trajectories, optimize routes dynamically, and provide high-reliability navigational support under varying atmospheric conditions while ensuring strict compliance with aviation safety standards.
designScenario.name: Advanced Navigation System

details.description: Compute and continuously update aircraft position in real-time using integrated GNSS and inertial measurement data.
Support dynamic route optimization and real-time flight path recalculations based on up-to-date aeronautical data and weather conditions.
Achieve a positional accuracy within ±5 meters with a minimum refresh rate of 12 Hz.
Ensure processing latency does not exceed 80 milliseconds to facilitate immediate response to environmental changes.
Integrate dual-sensor backup mechanisms to ensure continuous operation in the event of primary sensor failure.
Implement automatic switching to redundant systems and alert mechanisms to maintain safety integrity during component malfunctions.
Design intuitive pilot interfaces with clear visualization of navigational data, system alerts, and diagnostic feedback.
Facilitate remote system diagnostics and streamlined maintenance procedures for quick troubleshooting.

relationships.description: The Central Navigation Processor aggregates data from the GPS Receiver and Inertial Measurement Unit for sensor fusion.
The Central Navigation Processor aggregates inertial data from the Inertial Measurement Unit to complement satellite navigation.
The Central Navigation Processor depends on the Map and Terrain Data Module for real-time aeronautical updates.
The External Data Interface provides supplementary weather and traffic updates to the Central Navigation Processor.
The Pilot Display Interface is composed within the outputs of the Central Navigation Processor to present clear flight metrics to pilots.
The Redundant Monitoring Suite aggregates backup sensor data to support failover operations in the event of primary sensor failure.
The Autopilot Control Link depends on accurate navigation data computed by the Central Navigation Processor to execute flight maneuvers.
The Diagnostic Self-check Module independently monitors system components to flag anomalies and trigger maintenance protocols.

systemComponents.description: Core processing unit that orchestrates sensor fusion, route computation, and system diagnostics.
systemComponents.name: Central Navigation Processor

systemComponents.description: Module that receives satellite signals and converts them into navigational data.
systemComponents.name: GPS Receiver Module

subComponents.name: High-Gain Antenna

subComponents.description: Signal demodulator that processes raw satellite signals into digital data for navigation.
subComponents.name: Signal Demodulator

systemComponents.description: Module providing inertial data through motion sensors for dead reckoning and supplementary navigation.
systemComponents.name: Inertial Measurement Unit

subComponents.description: Gyroscopic sensor providing rotational data to support inertial navigation.
subComponents.name: Gyroscopic Sensor

systemComponents.description: Module responsible for external communications including weather, air traffic, and other operational updates.
systemComponents.name: External Data Interface

subComponents.description: VHF transceiver for high reliability communication.
subComponents.name: VHF Transceiver

subComponents.description: UHF transceiver for extended communication range and resilience.
subComponents.name: UHF Transceiver

systemComponents.description: Module managing up-to-date aeronautical charts, terrain data, and other essential navigation datasets.
systemComponents.name: Map and Terrain Data Module

systemComponents.description: User interface module to display essential navigational data and alerts to flight crew.
systemComponents.name: Pilot Display Interface

subComponents.description: Primary flight display presenting real-time navigation metrics.
subComponents.name: Primary Flight Display

subComponents.description: Tactical status panel providing supplemental flight and diagnostic information.
subComponents.name: Tactical Status Panel

systemComponents.description: Backup sensor module offering alternative sensor data to support navigation operations during primary sensor anomalies.
systemComponents.name: Redundant Monitoring Suite

subComponents.description: Backup GPS receiver module serving as a failover for primary satellite tracking.
subComponents.name: Backup GPS Receiver

subComponents.description: Backup inertial sensor to ensure continuous inertial data availability.
subComponents.name: IMU Backup Sensor

systemComponents.description: Interface module that communicates computed navigation data to the aircraft's autopilot system for automated flight control.
systemComponents.name: Autopilot Control Link

systemComponents.description: Module dedicated to system health monitoring and self-diagnostics to ensure consistent navigational performance.
systemComponents.name: Diagnostic Self-check Module

requirements.name: WirelessCommunicationRequirement
requirements.text: The system shall support wireless communications for receiving weather updates and air traffic information.

requirements.name: DigitalDataExchangeRequirement
requirements.text: The system shall provide digital data exchange and internet connectivity via the Data Modem.

rag_context: The Radio Navigation System provides wireless and wired communications for receiving external data such as weather updates and air traffic information. It consists of a Radio Transceiver for VHF/UHF communications and a Data Modem for digital data exchange and internet connectivity.
